description:
Hundreds of aliens inhabit our Earth today. Some friendly, some belligerent - some are here for research purposes while others came for the sake of committing crime. It is only us humans who have yet to realize their existence.

One day, a hell of a troublemaker arrives on our planet. Though he is regarded as the smartest man in the universe, he has a major flaw in his personality - he is always causing trouble to bide his time.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description:
__Alma Mater:__ Tokyo International University

[Website](https://kiramune.jp/artist/namikawa/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/namidai0402) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/namikawa--daisuke) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgrXnEIrI4LLgVYzGoQvJcg)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Un4v5s8bgsVk9Xp)

A Japanese manga artist. He is most notable for having created [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/manga/30053/Yu-Yu-Hakusho/), for which he received the Shogakukan Manga Award in 1994, and [Hunter × Hunter](https://anilist.co/manga/30026/Hunter-x-Hunter/). In 1987, Togashi received the 34th Tezuka Award, the most influential new comic artist award in Japan, for his one-shot Buttobi Straight. 

Togashi is married to [Naoko Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/96946/), the creator of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/manga/30092/Sailor-Moon/). His brother, [Hideaki Togashi](https://anilist.co/staff/174009/), is also a manga artist and has helped him work on his series on multiple occasions. 

Since 2006, Hunter x Hunter has gone on numerous lengthy hiatuses due to varying reasons, Including but not limited to: Togashi's struggle with Lumbago, exhaustion, and his mental health. His physical and mental health was also a leading cause in the premature conclusion of Yu Yu Hakusho.

[Website](http://ryokunihiko.com/)

Started taking piano lessons at age of 5. Attended in medical college about 3 years. From 1984 to 1985 he worked in a Tokyo hospital. After that he moved back to musical career. In 1996 he made his first solo album “The Gate Of Dreams”. 1998 second album “Into the Light”. “ONLY HEAVEN KNOWS” in 1999. 4th album “Pan-O-Rama” 2001. 2004 5th solo album ECHOES. He also made sountracks to DEAD HEAT,Emma,The Twelve Kingdoms and many more.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.
__Height:__ 162cm

ViViD is a visual kei band from Tokyo, Japan. ViViD was formed in 2009, and signed on PSC-Indies. in April 2009. ViViD consists of シン (Shin, vocals), 零乃 (Reno, guitar), 怜我 (Ryoga, guitar), イヴ (Iv, bass) and Ko-ki (crazy drummer & dj)
A regular presence in [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/)'s shows.
A regular presence in [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/)'s shows.
A regular presence in [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/)'s shows.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

**Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.
Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
